qas.question: Zen Buddhism is divided into how many main schools?
Which schools of Zen likes the use of meditation on the koan for spiritual breakthroughs?

context: Zen Buddhism is divided into <a0_0>two<a0_0/> main schools: <a1_0>Rinzai<a1_0/> (臨済宗) and Sōtō (曹洞宗), the former greatly favouring the use in meditation on the koan (公案, a meditative riddle or puzzle) as a device for spiritual break-through, and the latter (while certainly employing koans) focusing more on shikantaza or "just sitting".[note 13]
